thread.title: Bathroom bill could have consequences for Texas tourism
thread.title_full: Bathroom bill could have consequences for Texas tourism

author: Ileana Najarro
title: Bathroom bill could have consequences for Texas tourism
text: Bathroom bill could have consequences for Texas tourism Ileana Najarro Published 11:42 am, Friday, February 10, 2017 Photo: Brett Coomer, Staff Close Image 1 of 9 The NFL warned that passage of the "bathroom bill" could discourage the league from awarding any future Super Bowl opportunities in the state. >> Click the gallery to see events North Carolina missed out on because of HB2, the "bathroom bill." The NFL warned that passage of the "bathroom bill" could discourage the league from awarding any future Super Bowl opportunities in the state. >> Click the gallery to see events North Carolina missed Image 2 of 9 NCAA championships The NCAA pulled seven championships out of North Carolina after the state in 2016 approved House Bill 2, a so-called "Bathroom Bill" criticized as discriminating against gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender residents. Texas officials unveiled similar proposed legislation on Jan. 5, 2017, in Austin, leading some to caution that Texas could also be at risk of losing sports events and other business. In this file photo, Villanova fans cheer after their team wins the NCAA National Championship at NRG Stadium, Monday, April 4, 2016, in Houston. Click through these photos to see other organizations and companies that have canceled plans for events or business deals over so-called bathroom bills. less NCAA championships The NCAA pulled seven championships out of North Carolina after the state in 2016 approved House Bill 2, a so-called "Bathroom Bill" criticized as discriminating against gay, lesbian, bisexual Photo: Karen Warren, Houston Chronicle Image 3 of 9 PayPal expansion Peter Thiel is the founder of PayPal, which canceled plans in April 2016 for an expanded operations center in Charlotte, N.C., over that state's House Bill 2. PayPal expansion Peter Thiel is the founder of PayPal, which canceled plans in April 2016 for an expanded operations center in Charlotte, N.C., over that state's House Bill 2. Photo: SAUL LOEB, Staff Image 4 of 9 NFL Super Bowl Super Bowl XXVII in 1993 was initially scheduled to be played in Tempe, Ariz., but the National Football League moved it to the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, Calif., after Arizona voters in 1992 rejected a proposal to reinstate Martin Luther King Jr.'s birthday as a state holiday. In this file photo, w ide receiver Don Beebe of the Buffalo Bills (left) forces a fumble on defensive tackle Leon Lett of the Dallas Cowboys during Super Bowl XXVII, Jan. 31, 1993. The Cowboys won the game, 52-17. less NFL Super Bowl Super Bowl XXVII in 1993 was initially scheduled to be played in Tempe, Ariz., but the National Football League moved it to the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, Calif., after Arizona voters in 1992 rejected
